info.author: Mikel Larreategi
info.description:
Introduction
============

This small library has a method to create a MIME Multipart email object
with HTML and Text content to be able to send it by e-mail.

This allows you to prepare an HTML content (with a templating language)
and forget about the text representation of the HTML; just import the
method and call it with the HTML content and the e-mail headers (to, cc,
subject, ...)

This is the signature of the method::

  def create_html_mail(subject, html, text=None, from_addr=None, to_addr=None,
                     cc_addrs=[], headers=None, encoding='UTF-8'):

Changelog
=========

2.0 (2020-02-10)
----------------

- python3 compatibility
  [erral]

1.0 (2012-02-02)
-------------------

- Initial release
  [erral]
info.name: cs.htmlmailer
info.summary: A library to send emails with HTML and Text mixed content
info.html_description:
Introduction

This small library has a method to create a MIME Multipart email object with HTML and Text content to be able to send it by e-mail.

This allows you to prepare an HTML content (with a templating language) and forget about the text representation of the HTML; just import the method and call it with the HTML content and the e-mail headers (to, cc, subject, …)

This is the signature of the method:

def create_html_mail(subject, html, text=None, from_addr=None, to_addr=None,
                   cc_addrs=[], headers=None, encoding='UTF-8'):
